The Club provides members with a lifestyle that embodies the perfect balance of active living, professional success, athletic excellence, and socializing at our luxurious, gated golf and country club community. Nestled within our community are 28 distinct residential villages, each boasting its own distinctive character and charm. Our community boasts an impressive array of award-winning amenities, just minutes away from your doorstep, including a two-acre poolscape with a bistro, a 38,000-square-foot, LEED Certified Moonstone Spa & Fitness Center, 23 tennis courts, and 4 pickleball courts. And let's not forget about our two world-renowned golf courses, both GEO Certified and Audubon Sanctuary Certified. The Old Course was designed by Rees Jones and hosted the PGA Tour Champions James Hardie Pro Football of Fame Invitational. The Club Course was originally designed by Gene Bates and redesigned in 2017 by Matt Swanson. Our private club is renowned for its signature warmth, elegance, and genuine hospitality. We take pride in delivering a lifestyle that is second to none. CLUB VALUES The Members of Broken Sound believe in and are committed to a family-oriented club that is friendly and progressive, open, and responsive to the interests of its members and respectful of its customs and traditions. Broken Sound is known in the area for having a membership that promotes camaraderie and appreciates and supports its staff. CLUB VISION Provide the finest golf experience, facilities, and amenities for those seeking an active, meaningful, and fulfilling lifestyle. CLUB MISSION Broken Sound exists to increase the value of Broken Sound membership and the satisfaction of its members. We will preserve our natural beauty while maintaining championship-caliber golf courses and top-rated facilities, emphasizing sound fiscal management and service excellence, to provide members with a rewarding lifestyle and a friendly social environment. Learn More CLUB DETAILS Facility: Member-Owned Course Access: Private Number of Holes: 36 Golf Shop Sales: $1M (Cost +20% Model) Total Annual Rounds: 58,000 rounds of golf (Collectively) Old Course: 22,000 Annual Rounds, 350 Old Course Memberships, $200,000 Initiation Fee Club Course: 36,000 Annual Rounds, 470 Club Course Memberships, $150,000 Initiation Fee 60% of the membership are full-time residents Board Members: 9 Employees: 60 Employees (FTE) in season POSITION OVERVIEW Title: Senior Director of Golf Operations Reports to: General Manager/COO Supervises: Direct oversight of all golf operations, in close coordination with each course's Superintendent and other department heads Position Description: The Senior Director of Golf Operations (SDOG) at Broken Sound will be the leader, an engaged, highly visible presence, who takes full ownership of the club's golf operations. This individual will be a strategic, forward-thinking visionary, shaping the future of golf at Broken Sound while fostering meaningful connections with all member constituencies. The ideal candidate is a hands-on leader with their finger on the pulse of the entire golf experience. They will embody the highest standards of integrity, professionalism, and diplomacy, and be an approachable presence among both members and staff. A strong manager and an inspiring leader, the SDOG will value collaboration and respect the contributions of volunteers and team members at every level. They must be capable of setting and upholding high standards while holding both staff and members accountable to those expectations. The SDOG will be expected to elevate the golf experience through creative programming, exceptional service, and a strategic approach to operations. Ultimately, this is a role for someone with vision, intellect, business acumen, and the ability to shape and deliver a golf experience that reflects the excellence and energy of Broken Sound. INITIAL PRIORITIES AND KEY CHARACTERISTICS Team Builder - unify both Courses into a cohesive unit vs stand-alone operations and separate teams. A team builder who has a history of attracting, developing, motivating, and retaining a high-performance team of professionals to propel the operation forward Ability to sustain a culture of premier service and adherence to standards Knowledgeable in best practices in top-performing and high-member satisfaction operations across the country A highly visible and interactive individual committed to engaging members at every opportunity to develop high levels of member satisfaction A proven track record in player and program development, working with all levels of playing abilities and diverse skill levels to grow the game A strong team leader focused on two-way communication with all team members Experience in similar club environments where traditions and respect, both personally and with the Club, are intrinsically rooted To reiterate, fostering a culture of solidarity and teamwork throughout the team and the Club at large is very important to the staff and membership. Significant to this expectation is the ability to lead a team of friendly, engaging, competent, and passionate staff who are sincere about serving the Club's members. CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS A verifiable record of working closely and successfully in a private club, with an active Board and committees, while providing visionary leadership and partnership with the General Manager/COO A verifiably unblemished career track that demonstrates a record of tenure and commitment to previous employers, where career moves were for the enhancement of skills and experiences as opposed to unplanned career changes A minimum of 3-5 years of verifiable, progressive leadership and golf management experience. A high level of playing ability or playing enjoyment Strong golf community network Verifiable ability to attract, hire, develop, and lead a high-performing team of professionals while setting and maintaining standards of performance appropriate to perpetuating the mission and values of Broken Sound Exceptionally strong communication skills with members and staff, creating an open exchange environment to move the golf operations forward in a consistently positive, passionate manner EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS Including, but not limited to, the following: PGA Class A Certification is required A Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or Golf Management would be advantageous, but not required Working knowledge of Microsoft Office with specific emphasis on Word, Excel, and Outlook programs Prior knowledge and experience with Club Management Software with a focus on POS (Club Essentials), Tee Times (Fore Tee's), and Tournament Management (Golf Genius) programs. The Club is strongly interested in the best candidates, regardless of where they currently live, but those with ties to this geographic area, or the strong ability to grasp the overall "culture and style" of it, are critically important. The key attributes, as outlined above, include the proven ability to continue to elevate services, programming, and execution of a well-defined "mission." The role of the SDOG at Broken Sounds should be attractive to those qualified candidates seeking a stable, long-term commitment in the community with outstanding schools and quality of life. For the right individual with passion, enthusiasm, and consistently enhanced skill sets, Broken Sound can be the "pinnacle of one's career" role! COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS A base salary commensurate with experience, plus participation in the company's bonus program. Additionally, the following benefits apply: Medical, dental, vision, disability, & life insurance Paid vacation accrual according to company policy Holiday pay Cell phone allowance Playing & Practicing Privileges APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS All applications MUST be submitted through the PGA of America's Career Services Department as described below. Resume deadline is May 23, 2025 at 10:00 am Eastern Time Combine your cover letter, resume, references, and any supporting documents into one (1) PDF document with the following file naming convention: Last Name, First Name, Broken Sound Club, Senior Director of Golf Operations Please address all correspondence to - Mr. Ken Kosak | General Manager/COO | Broken Sound Club Click Here to Submit Your Application Ted Logan and Geoff Lofstead are leading this search. Description THE OLD COURSE AT BROKEN SOUND CLUB Home to the PGA Tour Champions Season Opener for 15 consecutive years (2007-2021), The Old Course is a secluded 18-hole course designed by industry leaders, Joe Lee (1978) Gene Bates (2004), and Rees Jones (2022). Hidden in the heart of Boca Raton, this golfer's sanctuary offers the camaraderie and ambiance you would expect in a traditional golf club in an unexpected private place. Reminiscent of courses in the Pinehurst, North Carolina area, you play the renowned course through a landscape of woods, stone bridges, wildlife, lakes, and lagoons. The Northern course style, with its varied elevation and eighty-five bunkers fulfill the needs of even the most diehard golfer. Although it has very small undulations compared to most clubs, the greens have been voted the best greens on the champions Tour by officials and players for the past fifteen years.
